page.title: 02Farming in St. John.
page.content:
There are two different kinds of{farms in the area.
On a{dairy}farm the cows are tethered to make the best use of the grass. They are milked twice a day in the morning and evening. The milk is kept in a cooler until a tanker arrives to collect it and take it to the dairy in St. Saviour.
The main crop grown on an{agricultural farm is potatoes. These are planted in early Spring and are harvested nowadays by machinery from late May onwards. They are bagged and taken to the harbour in St. Helier and shipped to the United Kingdom.
{Other crops}grown are market garden produce, e.g. cauliflowers, courgettes and calabrese.
